dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimmering waves of heat. A flat, unforgiving landscape stretches to infinity. A storm of dust gathers on the horizon, small at first, increasing in size as it rolls toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A withered tree is revealed f.g. with a rifle leaning against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS an arid expanse of scorched earth. J'ONN, a ragged and malnourished homesteader of some alien race, toils beneath a blazing sun, his BACK TO CAMERA. He sinks an auguring device into the ground, drilling in vain for water. There are many hundreds of holes in the earth around him. He suddenly straightens and squints into the dust storm as HOOFBEATS fill the SOUNDTRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J'onn releases his auguring device and hurries toward  his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horse and RIDER, dressed in a hooded cape, thunder toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The CAMERA TILTS DOWN revealing J'onn's rifle as he cocks the weapon. He uses stones as ammunition, which slip from his hand and fall to the parched ground as he tries to load the rifle. He turns and points the gun as the Rider continues his approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6   J'onn raises his gun as the Rider reins his horse to halt ten feet short of him. The beast snorts and stamps its hooves impatiently while the Rider studies the frightened homesteader and removes a breathing apparatus from his mouth. Finally, he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought weapons were forbidden on this planet. The Rider swings down from the saddle. He's tall, powerfully built beneath his dusty robes, his face shadowed by a hood. He indicates their bleak surroundings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I can't believe you'd kill me for a field of empty holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all I have. J'onn sags under the futile weight of existence. The Rider approaches him without fear. It's all the homestead can do to keep from sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pain runs deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know of my pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us explore it together. The Rider collects himself and concentrates deeply. J'onn is immediately transfixed. He begins to tremble. Tears flood his dirty cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; soothing tone) Each man hides a secret pain. It must be exposed and reckoned with. It must be dragged from darkness and forced into the light. Share your pain. Share your pain with me and gain strength from the sharing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: J'onn whimpers and cries out in anguish. Finally, the catharsis ends. J'onn sobs and rests his head on the Rider's chest. He opens his eyes and blinks in wonder  and amazement at the Rider as he comforts J'onn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power was within you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to find the words) I feel as if a weight has been lifted from my heart. How can I repay you for this miracle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join my quest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you seek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you seek. What all men have sought since time began - ultimate knowledge. But to find it we'll need a starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A starship? There are no starships on Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I have a way to bring one here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have faith, my friend. There are more of us than you know.

dialogues.speaker: RIDER
dialogues.text: As he throws back his hood to reveal rugged charismatic features. He's bearded, his hair is shaggy. He has the piercing eyes of a zealot and, to our surprise, pointed ears. His name is SYBOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a Vulcan. Sybock nods and does something we've never seen a Vulcan do. He smiles. As he does, the first faint bars of the STAR TREK THEME well up on the SOUNDTRACK.

dialogues.speaker: SYBOCK
dialogues.text: As he covers his smiling mouth with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok stands by his horse, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC and CREDITS PLAY OVER a dazzling journey through the cosmos. Planets, stars and solar systems flash by. No doubt about it, we're in for a rousing Star Trek adventure. As the FINAL CREDITS appear, we TILT DOWN to a breathtaking shot of EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand clutches at a sheer rock, groping for purchase. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal CAPTAIN JAMES T. KIRK eight hundred feet above the surrounding forest. He climbs up the face of El Captain without ropes, grommets or equipme Just man against mountain. Using the cracks in the rockface for hand and foot holes, Jim Kirk struggles up the treacherous incline, one painful inch at a time. We hold our breath, afraid he'll fall.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPSITE BELOW
dialogues.text: DR. LEONARD "BONES" McCOY watches Kirk's progress through futuristic binoculars with mounting unease. From this distance Kirk resembles a small fly on a big wall. (muttering toward the mountain) "You'll have a great time Bones,  You'll enjoy your shore leave. You'll be able to relax." (lowering binoculars) You call this relaxing? I'm a nervous wreck. If I'm not careful, I'll end up talking to myself.

dialogues.speaker: EL CAPITAN
dialogues.text: He inserts the pads of two fingers into a narrow crack above his head. He exhales, focussing concentration. Kirk pulls himself up, balancing on a ledge barely an inch wide. Exhilarated, he pauses to admire the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathtaking but vertigo-inducing HIGH ANGLE SHOT of Yosemite. This may be the 23rd Century but the park looks the same as it did three hundred years ago. There is a soft WHOOSHING SOUND and SPOCK suddenly rises

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock hovers in mid- air alongside the startled Kirk, kep aloft by means of levitation boots. His hands are clasped behind his back, typically Spock-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock - What are you doing in this neck of the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flattered. Twelve hundred points of interest in Yosemite and you pick me. Spock doesn't take Kirk's hint to get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I regret to inform you that the record for free-climbing El Captain is in no danger of being broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to break any records. I'm doing this because I enjoy it. Not to mention the most important reason for climbing a mountain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MM.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not think you realize the gravity of your situation. Kirk slips but manages to gain a handhold and save himsel Beneath his feet, a mini-avalanche of rocks is dislodged, tumbling to the valley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary. Gravity is foremost on my mind. Look, I'm trying to make an ascent here. Why don't you go pester Dr McCoy for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe Dr McCoy is not in the best of moods.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPSITE BELOW
dialogues.text: McCoy, still watching Kirk's progress, is getting angrier by the second. Goddamn..irresponsible... playing games with life...

dialogues.speaker: EL CAPITAN
dialogues.text: Kirk strains for the next handhold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentration is vital. You must be one with the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, I appreciate your concern, but if you don't stop distracting me, I'm liable to be one... And as Kirk reaches for the next crack, the ledge comes loose underfoot and he finds himself falling.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: He dives after Kirk, firing boosters to increase his speed.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Twisting and turning end over end as he hurtles downward. He thrashes at the air, unable to defeat gravity.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPSITE
dialogues.text: McCoy turns away, unable to look. Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Dropping...dropping..the ground rushing up like a hungry mouth. A split second before impact...

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: The Vulcan swoops INTO SHOT. His powerful fingers grab Kirk by the ankle and jerk him upward in the nick of time

dialogues.speaker: CAMPSITE
dialogues.text: McCoy hasn't heard the expected splat. He turns to look and what he sees is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is suspended in air, bobbing upside-down at the end of Spock's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top of Kirk's head is practically touching the ground. That's how close he came to being pizza. Kirk blinks in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps "because it is there" is not sufficient reason for climbing a mountain. Kirk dangles - undignified but lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hardly in a position to disagree. McCoy is heard in approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy is seen upside-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bones. Mind if we drop in for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The single outpost of civilization on this desolate world - a small, ramshackle village smack in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by high walls. A lone rider on horseback crosses the desert, headed for the outpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 23rd Century equivalent of a frontier saloon. Futuristi honky-tonk MUSIC. The patrons are rugged, unpleasant type Klingons, Romulans, Andorians, you name it. Much drink and boisterous talk. Arguments. Fistfights. Two men play futuristic "pool" on a table filled with water.

dialogues.speaker: A SEXY CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: Dances atop of the bar, flicking her long striped tail an hissing seductively at her rowdy audience.

dialogues.speaker: SALOON DOOR
dialogues.text: A STRANGER coming from outside approaches familiar western-style doors. But instead of swinging open like you'd expect, they WHOOSH apart automatically. The stranger steps into the bar and the doors WHOOSH back into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk and noise go dead as the entire saloon turns its attention to the newcomer. The stranger, seen only from the back, steps into the squalid bar. The Bartender jerks his thumb in the direction of the back room. The stranger crosses to the back room and disappears inside. Talk and noise resume. A VEIWSCREEN is revealed b.g. As the cloaked stranger passes through the room toward the back, we hear: TELEVISION ANNOUNCER'S VOICE ...your dream can become a reality... the Paradise Inn...lots to choose from. We at the Paradise Inn attempt to create the closest thing to paradise in Paradise City, that is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stranger lowers the breathing device from her face and is revealed to be a young woman. A Romulan. Her name is CAITHLIN DAR and she stands on the threshold of the room, trying to adjust her eyes to the murky surroundings. She's a little nervous and a long way from home. The back room is a storage area for unwanted odds and ends. A ceiling fan swishes overhead pushing hot air around. Two men are sprawled in chairs at opposite ends of a table. They're two busy drinking to notice Caithlin's entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm Caithlin Dar. The man seated closest to Caithlin slowly swivels his hea in her direction. He wearily extracts himself from his chair and comes forward. He's a Terran (specifically, an Englishman) named ST. JOHN TALBOT. Thin and dissipated alcoholic, Talbot is a veteran of the diplomatic corps. H pats down his unruly hair and straightens his soiled suit He gives Caithlin a tired smile and extends a limp hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. Our new Romulan representative. Welcome to Paradise City, my dear, capital of the so-called "Planet of Galactic Peace." I'm St John Talbot, the Federation representative here on Nimbus III. My charming companion here is the Klingon consul, Korrd... Caithlin regards the hulking figure at the other end of the table. KORRD is an old, overweight Klingon, a once-great warrior past his prime. He doesn't rise to greet Caithlin. Instead, he takes a swig from a flagon and emits an earth-shaking belch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect that's Klingon for hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you come in, my dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J'onn clambers over a dune with determination. He aims his gun as Sybock and his mount ride majestically to the top of the dune and continue on, followed by Sybok's soldiers, a virtual army of ragged settlers - aliens of every different race, the poor and the downtrodden - unit in their devotion to Sybok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago, our three governments agree to develop this planet together. Korrd pours a drink from a bottle into his cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new age was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our new age has died a quick death. And the settlers we conned into coming here - they were the dregs of the galaxy. They immediately took to fighting amongst themselves. We forbade them weapons and they soon began to fashion their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, it appears I've arrived just in time. Korrd looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... There are shouts from outside and the whine of a warning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of sentries brace themselves against the gate. It suddenly gives way. CAMERA CRANES UP OVER the top of the arch to reveal Sybok's army on the threshold of the city. In their midst, towering majestically above them, is Sybok on horseback. He urges his mount forward. With quiet determination, he and his army pour under the arch and proceed up the main drag. Townspeople scurry for protection, anticipating an attack Those who consider challenging Sybok are allayed by the crude weapons and intimidating looks of the followers. Sybok intends to take this town by show of force without having to fire a shot. And it looks like he'll succeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korrd, Caithlin and Talbot emerge to see what the hubbub is about. When they see the approaching forces, Korrd and Talbot immediately turn tail and run back inside. After a moment, Caithlin follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korrd, fearing the worst, goes behind the bar and opens a bottle. He upends it and pours the contents down his throat. He prefers to die drunk. Talbot and Caithlin hurry to the viewscreen. Talbot moves to turn off the program being broadcast. TELEVISION ANNOUNCER'S VOICE ....we have spared no expense to create the closest thing to.... Caithlin and Talbot wait as a communications screen rises in front of them. The saloon doors are forced open. J'onn rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from that transmitter! Korrd lifts his drink. J'onn grabs him; Korrd pushes back CAMERA PANS to reveal two armed soldiers who grab Korrd a hold him. The KLAXON winds down to eerie silence as Sybok enters, observing the action. He is followed by several soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appraising them one by one) Romulan. Terran. Klingon. Consider yourselves my prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners? We're already prisoners on this worthless lump of rock. What possible value could we be to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimbus III may be a worthless lump of rock, but it does have one unique treasure. It's the only place in the entire galaxy that has the three of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are or what you want but I can tell you this: our governments will stop at nothing to insure our safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I'm counting on. On Caithlin's confused look..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging in space like a big Christmas ornament. The big blue marble called Earth is visible in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, cavernous area designed as a high-and-dry for space vessels. Among this warehouse of ships is the one we know best - U.S.S.ENTERPRISE; NCC-1701-A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S.S. Enterprise, shakedown cruise report. I think this new ship was put together by monkeys. She's got a fine engine, but half the doors won't open. And guess whose job it is to make it right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meager repair crew lazily overhauls consoles and monitors. Some things work, most do not. One thing that does work is CHIEF ENGINEER MONTGOMERY SCOTT who looks up as COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER UHURA enters, stepping around cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbling to himself; as he rises) Borgus Frat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; grumbling to himself) "Let's see what she's got," said the Captain. And then we found out, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you'll whip her into shape, Scotty. You always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, I thought you were on leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought we were supposed to be going together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I cannot leave her now when she needs me the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling you would say something like that. So I brought us dinner. She holds up small modernistic food packs. Scotty takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, lassie, you're the most understanding woman I know. The bridge light starts to flash red. An ear-splitting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, Red, Red Alert. Red Alert. Red, Red, Red Alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just fixed that damn thing. A man enters in b.g. carrying a cable over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off, will you? Two men look at the console with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Alert. Red Alert. This is a Red Alert. Enterprise acknowledge. Uhura goes to her console, punches a button and responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Enterprise. Identify  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, this is Starfleet. We have a Priority Seven situation in the Neutral Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by Starfleet. Scotty, this is for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be serious. The ship's in pieces and we've less than a skeleton aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet, are you aware of our currant status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Currant status understood. Stand by to copy operational orders and recall key personnel. Uhura and Scotty share grim looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMMANDERS SULU and CHEKOV tramp through dense woods. From their weary expressions it's clear they've been hiking a long time. Sulu leads the way. Chekov trudges behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit it. We're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we're lost. But we're making good time. Sulu's communicator BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Sulu, come in, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. Commander Sulu here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura studies a monitor showing Sulu and Chekov as two blips on a grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news, gentlemen. Shore leave's been cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescued at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to prearranged coordinates for pickup. Sulu and Chekov look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell them you're lost. You'll never live it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... yes. We've been caught in a blizzard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we can't see a thing. Request you direct us to the coordinates. Chekov provides blizzard noises. On Enterprise, Uhura listens to the "blizzard" and checks her graphics display for weather report. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My visual says sunny skies and seventy degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu! Look! The sun's come out! It's a miracle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, fellas. Your secret's`  safe with me. I'll send the shuttlecraft to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, I owe you one. Sulu out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy stands over a blazing campfire. A covered pot simmers on the coals. McCoy rings a TRIANGLE. He's slightly tipsy. Come and get it! Com and get it! CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Kirk and Spock seated two feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it.. knock it... Bones... Bones.. knock it off. We're right here. And we're starving. McCoy grins and crouches beside the covered pot. He revel in their undivided attention. With a flourish, he whips the lid off the pot to reveal a steaming mess of beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bi-podal seeds, Doctor? Beans, Spock. But no ordinary beans. These are from an old Southern recipe handed down to me by my father. And if you stick your Vulcan nose up at these, you're not only insulting me, but generations of McCoy's. McCoy ladles out the beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, I have little choice but to sample your... beans. Kirk tears into his. Spock tries a forkful. He finds the taste strangely exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Surprisingly good. It does have a flavoring I'm not familiar with. Ah, that's the secret ingredient. Spock eats with enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any more of that secret ingredient, Bones? Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy grins and pulls out a bottle of bourbon. Spock stops in mid-chew and McCoy fills Kirk's cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to understand that your secret ingredient is.. alcohol? Whiskey. Tennessee whiskey, Spock. You care for a little snort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bourbon and beans, an explosive combination. Think Spock can handle it? Are you kidding? With that Vulcan metabolism, he could eat a bowl of termites and it wouldn't bother him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you are so fond of pointing out, Doctor, I am half human. Well, it certainly doesn't show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that - this guy never changes. I insult him and he takes it as a compliment. Mmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you two could drive a man to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? What did you do? You really piss me off, Jim. Human life is far too precious to risk crazy stunts. Maybe it didn't cross that macho mind of yours, but you should've been killed when you fell off that mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It crossed my mind. And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, even as I fell, I knew I wouldn't die. Oh? I thought he was the only one who's immortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. It isn't that. I knew I wouldn't die because the two of you were with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always known... I'll die alone. Well, I'll call Valhalla and have them reserve a room for you. It's a mystery to me what draws us together. All that time in space - getting on each other's nerves. And what do we do when shore leave comes along? We spend it together. Other people have families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people, Bones. Not us. They dwell on this thought for a moment. Then, Kirk notices that Spock has removed a sack from his backpack. Spock reaches into the sack and takes out a marshmallow which he attaches to the end of a pointed stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am preparing to toast a marsh melon. Marsh melon? Kirk and McCoy hide their smiles as Spock holds the marshmallow over the fire. Well, I'll be damned. A marsh melon. Where'd you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before leaving the ship, I consulted the computer library to familiarize myself with the customs associated with "camping out." Kirk and McCoy play along, amused by Spock's dead serious approach to frivolity. Well, tell me, Spock. What do you do after we toast the marsh - er, marsh melons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We consume them. I know we consume them. I mean after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I believe we are required to engage in a ritual known as the singalong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. I haven't sung around a campfire since I was a boy in Iowa. What are we going to sing? What... Bones, what are we going to sing? How about "Camptown Races?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pack Up Your Troubles."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we leaving, Captain? It's a song title, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Moon Over Rigel Seven?" "Row, row, row your boat..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Row, row, row your boat..." I love "Row..." Do - do you know "Row, Row, Row, Row, Row Your Boat?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That song did not come up in my research, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lyrics are - are very simple. It's, er, "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream.." The Doctor and I will start it off, and then when we give you the signal, you jump in. Doctor, if you please. McCoy takes a hit of booze and clears his throat. Don't say I didn't warn you. McCoy starts to sing. Kirk joins in. Maybe it's the bourbon, but the two of them sound pretty good. "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream... merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream..." They signal Spock that it is his turn to jump in but the Vulcan merely regards them quizzically. The singalong grinds to a halt. ...life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Spock. Why didn't you jump in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to comprehend the meaning of the words. It's a song, you green-blooded Vulcan. You sing it. The words aren't important. What's important is that you have a good time singing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I am sorry, Doctor. Were we having a good time? God, I liked him better before he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, let's call it a night, will ya? He just keeps after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to bed and just let's get some sleep. They prepare for bed.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPSITE
dialogues.text: Under a twinkling sky the three men sit around the campfire. Faint night sounds. Crickets. An owl. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, we're on leave. You can call me Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is not a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Bones. Goodnight, Jim. They all lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Doctor. Goodnight, Spock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Jim. I don't know. I just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NASA Pioneer probe trumbles through space. Ancient, forgotten, the device is flotsam. O it's side is a plaque showing images of two humans and simple mathematical and scientific symbols. It comes PAST CAMERA and OUT OF SHOT. In the distance, a distortion appears and out of this distortion, a Klingon Bird of Prey materializes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors separate to admit KLAA, the Bird of Prey's swashbuckling young Captain. He is met by VIXIS, his First Officer, a statuesque Klingon female. It's clear she adores Klaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Captain Klaa, we have a target in sight. A probe of ancient origin.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (n Klingon; subtitled) (Difficult to hit?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Most difficult.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Good.) Klaa's crew watches with excitement as their Captain straps himself into his command chair which has been equipped with an elaborate gunner's rig allowing Klaa to do the shooting himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Klingon; subtitled) (All weapons to my control) A periscope-like device swings into position in front of Klaa's flashing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Klingon; subtitled) (Scope!)

dialogues.speaker: PERISCOPE
dialogues.text: The probe is a tiny travelling speck in the distance. It' course is erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe tumbles through space as the Bird of Prey swoop down for the attack. Machine gun-like phasers are mounted on the Bird's wings. They come to life and swivel, BLASTING a flange off the front of the probe. A SECOND BLAST destroys a fin on the rear of the craft. A THIRD SHOT blows away the antennae. Klaa is toying with the target. He hesitates, then finishes the probe off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vixis and anther crewman stand by, admiring their Captain and his deadly skill. But Klaa seems dissatisfied

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Shooting space garbage is no test of a warrior's mettle. I need a target that fires back.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Captain, new data. Hostages on Nimbus III.) Klaa unstraps himself from the command chair and joins Vixis at a monitor screen. The fearsome face of a KLINGON COMMANDER fills the screen and starts barking Klingon ove shots of Nimbus III and the Paradise outpost. It's clear that the Bird of Prey is being ordered to Nimbus III. Klaa and Vixis are charged with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Klingon; subtitled) (One of the hostages is a Klingon.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (And the others?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (A Terran and A Romulan.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (That means the Federation will be sending a rescue ship of its own.) (Plot course for Nimbus III. I've always wanted to engage a Federation ship.)

dialogues.speaker: YOSEMITE
dialogues.text: A blinding light, a ball of great intensity, sets down on the edge of the campsite, rounding Kirk, Spock and McCoy from sleep. Get that damn light out of my face! The three men rise and watch as a figure in silhouette emerges from the light and comes forward. It's Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott apologizes for having to send the shuttlecraft. The transporter beam is non-operational. Captain, we've received important orders from Starlet Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you beep my communicator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ER... You forgot to take it with you. Uhura hands Kirk his communicator. It's clear he left it behind on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I wonder why I did that? Well, gentlemen, it appears shore leave has been cancelled. Pack out your trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bright light leaves the deserted campsite and rises against the mountain. It turns TOWARD CAMERA and reveals itself as a sleek shuttlecraft of impressive design. Aft thrusters fire and it shoots skyward.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: The ship is seen in her shining glory above Earth, framed against a full moon. The approaching Galileo shuttlecraft is dwarfed by the magnificent starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Galileo 5, capable of transporting two dozen personnel. At the moment its passengers are Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Uhura, who pilots the craft. Kirk gazes fondly at the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... all I ask is a tall ship and a star to steer by." Melville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Masefield. Are you sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am well-versed in the classics, Doctor. Then how come you don't know "Row, Row, Row Your Boat?" Spock raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIEWSCREEN,  a graphic of the approaching shuttlecraft ANGLE WIDENS to reveal Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for landing. Enterprise, you have control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH OVERLOOKING LANDING BAY
dialogues.text: Bay doors open to receive Galileo. The tractor beam locks onto the shuttlecraft and slowly pulls her inside. It's a delicate maneuver. Even with wings retracted, the Galileo clears the doors with only a few feet on either side.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH OVERLOOKING LANDING BAY
dialogues.text: Scotty operates the controls.

dialogues.speaker: BAY AND STAGING AREA
dialogues.text: The shuttlecraft comes in for a smooth landing. Its side hatch opens to allow Kirk and company to exit. There's no one to greet them, just a few crewmen scurrying around. Scotty appears. He may be exhausted and covered with grime but he's in his element.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can say is that they don't make them like they used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you could have the ship operational  in two weeks. I gave you three. What Happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you gave me too much time, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Mr. Scott. Carry on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to some unfortunate crewman) How many times do I have to tell you? The right tool for the right  job... CAMERA FOLLOWS Kirk into the turbolift where Spock, McCoy and Uhura await. I don't think I've seen him happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level.. level.. level..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge. I hope. Turbolift doors close with a GRINDING SOUND. Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Uhura are carried upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A surprised reaction from Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers come to life. Screens activate.

dialogues.speaker: TURBOLIFT
dialogues.text: A WHOOSH but only half the automatic door slides open. The other half is stuck. Kirk must manually force it open to enter the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't anything work on this  ship? Starfleet's got some nerve sending us out in this condition with this handful of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain on the bridge. An ATTRACTIVE YEOMAN comes forward with the jacket of Kirk's uniform. He shrugs off his camping jacket as Uhura and Spock go to their stations. McCoy shakes his head at the noisy, messy bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Starfleet transmission on line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the veiwscreen, would You please? Kirk looks at a wall console which begins shorting out. A crewman lies beneath it as sparks begin to fly. The crewman hits his head on the wall console; more sparks. Kirk takes his captain's uniform jacket from the Yeoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we have a little quiet, please? He puts on his Captain's jacket. The CAMERA PANS to reveal the veiwscreen. Kirk points, indicating the static on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you clear that up? The Yeoman and a crewman stand near a toolkit which toppl over. Kirk is beginning to get aggravated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Kirk is still fiddling with his buttons as the face of THE STARFLEET COMMANDER appears. Behind the Commander, images and data. The image is shaky at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we have it quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, this is Starfleet Operations. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...? Well, we're dressing informally, aren't we? Kirk tucks in his shirt as he looks up at the veiwscreen. His T-shirt reds: "Go Climb a Rock."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me on my way to the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for canceling shore leave, but look, we have a dangerous situation out on Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On "The Planet Of Galactic Peace?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same. From what we can make out, a terrorist force has captured the only settlement. And they've taken hostages. McCoy and Spock look at the O.S. action on the VIEWSCREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingon, the Romulan, the Federation consuls. Now I know Enterprise is not exactly up to specs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, the Enterprise is a disaster. There must be other  ships in the quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other ships, yes. But no experienced commanders. Captain, I need Jim Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your orders are to proceed to Nimbus III, assess the situation and avoid a confrontation if possible. Above all, however, get those hostages back safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the Klingons responded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but you can bet they will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. Kirk out. Kirk addresses his expectant crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid the ship's problems will have to be solved en route. Since we're undermanned, I'm counting on each one of you to give his best. End of speech. Let's go to work. McCoy slides over to Kirk. Jim if you ask me, and you haven't, I think this is a terrible idea. We're bound to run into the Klingons and they don't exactly like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling's mutual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need all the power you can  muster, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry, Captain. We'll beat those Klingon devils even if I have to get out and push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it won't come to that, Mr. Scott. Kirk turns off the comm, picks up his camping gear and sits in the Captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All possible speed, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, sir. Kirk settles into his command chair. He shifts uncomforta What's the matter, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss my old chair.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: He contemplates their situation with concern.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE GALAXY
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey slices through the fabric of space headed for Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa paces his deck like a restless buccaneer, eager for confrontation. Vixis approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (The Starship Enterprise has been dispatched to Nimbus III.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Enterprise? That's Kirk's ship! If I could defeat Kirk...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (...you would be the greatest  warrior in the galaxy.) This fact isn't lost on Klaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Maximum speed!) The crew hops to it. Klaa turns to Vixis and gives her the chest-thumping Klingon salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Success!) Vixis passionately returns the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Success!)

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: As she sails toward the Neutral Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's Log, Stardate 8450...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK AND ROTATES as Kirk impatiently drums his hand on the malfunctioning Captain's Log disk machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's Log, Stardate 84 fif... The recorder malfunctions again; a portion pops out. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Kirk looking off at the Yeoman. Uhura stands near the wall console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Captain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Forget it. The Yeoman takes the malfunctioning Captain's Log and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we're receiving the hostage information you requested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS to reveal veiwscreen b.g. Kirk joins Sulu and Chekov at the control board; is seated in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an authorized transmission from Starfleet Galactic Memory Bank. Spock and McCoy come forward to watch.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE VEIWSCREEN
dialogues.text: The screen comes to life and fizzles out. Then pops back on. Factual information, photographs, film and visual illustrations depict the backgrounds of the three hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same. He's apparently fallen out of favor with the Klingon High Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Korrd's military strategies were required learning when I was a cadet at the Academy. When they put me out to pasture, I hope I fare better than Korrd. Oh, this must be the hostage tape. A tape of poor quality. Images and SOUND come and go. A static shot of Caithlin Dar, flanked by Talbot and Korrd. Unlike the lively girl of the first scene. Caithlin is now restrained, dazed. Talbot and Korrd are also strangely subdued. In the b.g. we can see several of Sybok's soldiers brandishing weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time ago, we willingly surrendered ourselves to the forces of the Galactic Army of Light. At this moment we're in their protective custody. Their leader assures us that we will be treated humanely so long as you cooperate with his demands. I believe his sincerity. He requests that you send a Federation starship to parlay for our release at once. Be assured that we are in good health, and would appreciate your immediate response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deeply regret this desperate act, but these are desperate times. I have no desire to harm these innocents but do not put me to the test. I implore you to respond immediately. End of transmission. Spock strides to Uhura's console. He backwinds the tape and FREEZE FRAMES on Sybok's face. It's blurry, indistinct. Spock is transfixed by the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? You look like you've seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I have, Captain. Perhaps I have.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: As the ship comes PAST CAMERA, we move in on a single window in the forward area of the dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast area designed for contemplation. The most arresting feature is an antique ship's wheel - the kind Horatio Hornblower might have steered. The wheel stands in front of tall curving windows that offer an impressive space vista. Spock is beside the wheel staring at the stars, lost in thought. Kirk and McCoy enter with urgency and approach Spock, interrupting is reverie. Throughout the following, Spock continues to stare thoughtfully at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, what is it? Do you know this Vulcan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot be certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he does seem familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reminds me of someone I knew in my youth. Why, Spock, I didn't know you had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not often think of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it he reminds you of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a young student, exceptionally gifted, possessing of great intelligence. It was  assumed that one day he would take his place amongst the great scholars of Vulcan. But he was a  revolutionary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knowledge and experience he sought were forbidden by Vulcan belief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rejected his logical upbringing and embraced the animal passions of our ancestors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He believed the key to self-knowledge was emotion, not logic. Imagine that. A passionate Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he encouraged others to follow him, he was banished from Vulcan, never to return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way. Kirk and McCoy head for the exit. Kirk hesitates on the threshold. He looks back into the room. Spock is still at the window, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock? Spock snaps out of it. He hurries to join Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura seated at a wall console, Sulu at the control board. Kirk takes the Captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hailing frequency open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard orbit, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we're receiving transmission from Paradise City. They're demanding to know our intentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respond with static. Let them think we're having difficulty. Which wouldn't be far from the  truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paradise City, can you boost your power? We're barely receiving transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter room. Status.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, hard at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty here, Captain. Transporter is still inoperative. Even if we could lock onto the hostages, we couldn't beam them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to get them out the old fashioned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon vessel now entering quadrant. Bird of Prey. Estimating 1.9 hours until her weapons come to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Let's go. He and Sulu rise and walk to McCoy at the sliding doors.

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV
dialogues.text: He turns toward the veiwscreen where Nimbus III is seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttlecraft Galileo 5 streaks toward the planet's surface, deploying wings as it enters the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low-combat lighting. Sulu occupies the pilot's seat. Nearby are Uhura and seven Enterprise crewmen. Kirk and Spock are huddled over a graphics screen. They are dressed in field uniform. Phasers and transparen shields have been dispensed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their equipment is primitive but effective. I recommend we land at Coordinate 8563.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That puts us pretty far away from Paradise City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To land any closer would risk detection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu. Execute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttlecraft swoops out of the dark sky and skims the surface of Nimbus III. The CAMERA PANS the desolate terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramshackle of buildings of Paradise City are illumina by the light of two moons hanging overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paradise City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov addresses Sybok from the communication screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Starship Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Federation starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Pavel Chekov speaking. You are in violation of Neutral Zone  Treaty. I advise you to release your hostages at once or suffer the consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your threats amuse me, Captain Chekov. What consequences did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttlecraft swivels as it lands. The doors open revealing its crew. Kirk leads them from the craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As "Captain" Chekov continues the ruse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even as we speak, a Klingon warship is on its way. We estimate arrival within the hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine the Klingons will be quite angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a master of understatement. They are likely to destroy the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's fortunate that I have you and your starship to protect me. In the meantime, Captain Chekov, I instruct you and your First Officer to beam down to my coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will be happy to beam down. But first we must have certain assurances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galileo lies behind a dune. The light of Paradise City are glimpsed over the rise, a mile off. Kirk and Spock lie on a dune with night vision binoculars. There's nothing between them but flat expanse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At footspeed I estimate the journey to Paradise City at 1.2 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have 1.2 hours.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK'S PIOV
dialogues.text: A tiny oasis in the near distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Wait a minute... Perfect. But we will have to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BAND OF RAGTAG SOLDIERS gathers around a campfire. They are six in number, all men, members of Sybok's force. They are heavily robed to retard the night chill. They chat and drink. Nearby, their horses slip from a meager spring. A BLACK SOLDIER lifts his head and smiles as a woman's SONG floats out of the darkness- soft and mysterious, seductive. The soldiers look at each other in surprise, then rise en masse to seek the scource of the singing. The Black Soldier rises and steps toward the SOUND. Another soldier joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, atop a dune and silhouetted against the low hanging twin moons... a female. But not just any female. This siren undulates as she sings, moving sensuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Drawn like moths to a flame. The Black Soldier rises; they stumble over each other to get a closer look, climbing on hands and knees up the steep dune where Lorelei Uhura waits at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? As the soldiers continue to climb the dune toward Uhura, two Enterprise crewmen enter and point their phasers at them. Other crewmen lie in the sand flanking Uhura's dancing feet. The Soldiers, taken by surprise, stop mid-climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, boys... I've always wanted to play to a captive audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snarling horses pound over a rise, sending sand in all directions. Riders hurtle PAST CAMERA with flowing capes and cowled faces. Ahead of them, Paradise City. Behind them, the desert - a sea of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: Kirk rides with determination, his face nearly hidden behind a burnoose. He looks over at the rider beside him. It's Spock, bouncing stiffly in the saddle, doing all he can to hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be one with the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed sentries watch from the walls as the scruffy band of horsemen crosses the desert. J'onn, Sybok's first convert, appears looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the gate. It's our lookout party. The huge iron gate swings open.

dialogues.speaker: THE HORSEMEN
dialogues.text: They gallop at full tilt, led by Kirk. He shouts frantically to the sentries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federation soldiers right behind us. Close the gate! As Kirk and his party gallop through, the gate is closed behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and company proceed up the street, coaxing their horses toward the saloon at its end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they going? They ride slowly, not wanting to attract more any more attention than they have. Occasionally a crew member drops away from the group and dismounts, taking a position where he can lay down cover for the eventual escape.

dialogues.speaker: THE HORSEMEN
dialogues.text: Kirk's eyes sweep around. There are soldiers on most of the rooftops, heavily armed and dangerous-looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock. Spock hides a tricorder in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horse, Captain. I'm scanning. The hostages are in the structure just ahead. Hiding it from view, Kirk raises a communicator to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Strike Team. Start your run.

dialogues.speaker: GATE
dialogues.text: While the others watch the desert, J'onn turns to watch the horsemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? J'onn rushes to the big spotlight anchored on the wall. He swings its bright beam in the direction of the horsemen.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Sulu and Kirk are revealed as the light sweeps across them. Kirk and the others turn and react to the light, realizing the jig is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phasers on stun! Get rid of the mounts! Sulu - take out that light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain. The crewmen dismount and whip out the phaser rifles they've hidden under their robes.

dialogues.speaker: SULU
dialogues.text: Sulu spears his horse and charges at the spotlight as pebbles fired from the enemy's crude weapons whiz around him like hungry hornets. He gallops toward the blinding light. A BAZOOKA SHELL EXPLODES near him and he is knocked from his mount, but manages to roll away toward the spotlight and rises up to his knees. He raises his phaser and with an expert shot, blows the spotlight to bits as J'onn holds it. The street goes dark, lit now by neon and the flash of gunfire and phasers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok reacts to the gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I instruct you to surrender. You are under attack by Federation forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what you've done? It wasn't bloodshed I wanted. Sybok turns and strides out of the room, his robes swirling around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A symphony of smoke and gunfire. Dizzying action. Running figures. Stampeding horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk dismounts; his horse runs off. A soldier rushes in and thrusts his weapon at Kirk, who grabs it and strikes the man in the face. He knocks him O.S. and takes the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers on the walls and rooftops open fire with their crude weapons. The Enterprise crewmen fight back from strategic positions along the street, expertly picking off the enemy and using their transparent shields to repel the volley of pebbles.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: A soldier grabs Kirk; they struggle. Kirk flips him OUT OF SHOT. Another soldier hurries in shooting as he climbs over a wall. Other crewmen hit still more soldiers with phaser fire. They scream and fall.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: The Vulcan dismounts. As he heads for the saloon AN ENEMY SOLDIER leaps from a balcony, landing squarely in the saddle of Spock's horse. Armed with a sword the Soldier urges the steed forward to trample Spock. As Spoc turns in response, the Soldier rears the horse up on its hind legs. Hooves threaten to pummel Spock to a hamburger Spock calmly reaches up and presses his fingers into the horse's neck, executing a Vulcan nerve pinch. The horse and its rider tumble to the ground as Spock walks off.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: He stands in the doorway, back-lit by an inner bright lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, come on down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura is at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. Coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok's soldiers set up a multiple pipe weapon cranked like a Gattling gun. Like the other weapons, it uses pebbles for bullets. One of them catches an Enterprise crewman in the leg. He goes down.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Kirk shoots his phaser toward the lights of the building housing the saloon. The lights EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and empty. Phaser drawn, Kirk cautiously makes his way across the room when, with a sudden hiss, the Dancing Catwoman leaps over the bar and pounces on his back. As she claws at him, Kirk twirls her around in an "airplane spin" and throws her the length of the room. The Catwoman lands in the "pool" table, sending up a wave of water that soaks the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock enters and reacts to the unconscious floating Catwoman as Kirk blasts open the door to the back room. TELEVISION ANNOUNCER'S VOICE ... recreational opportunities are limitless.. The vicinity is famous for plentiful local wildlife. And the fishing is terrific... Caithlin, Korrd and Talbot look up in surprise. Kirk breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: Spock appears at Kirk's side. TELEVISION ANNOUNCER'S VOICE (continuing; overlapping) ... easy financing through Federation Federal can put you in your own home on the beautiful, conveniently located...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God...

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSTAGES
dialogues.text: Kirk signals for the hostages to follow them. But the hostages confound them by pointing three crude pistols at their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind handing over your weapons? TELEVISION ANNOUNCER'S VOICE Beam on down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock are marched out off the saloon by the hostages. The rest of the Enterprise crew is herded together to the accompaniment of thunderous cheers from Sybok's soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, my friends. An armed soldier pushes Uhura toward a smiling Sybok and J'onn.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: As the cheers begin to die, Spock detaches himself from Kirk and McCoy. Sybok notices him. For the first time we see him vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock. It's me. It's Sybok. After all these years, you've finally caught up with me. Don't you have anything to say to me? It's clear Sybok is trying to force an emotional reaction from Spock. But Spock refuses to fall into his trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are under arrest for seventeen violations of the Neutral Zone Treaty. Sybok is incredulous. There must be a hundred guns pointe at Spock's heart. Sybok can't help it. He chuckles. The chuckle becomes a full rich laugh. The soldiers join in and soon their laughter is ringing through Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, you've developed a sense  of humor after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not my intention to amuse you. These are serious charges. However, if you surrender now-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Spock. I can't surrender now. I'm not through violating Neutral Zone Treaty. In fact, I'm just getting started. And now for my next violation I intend to steal something. Something very big. J'onn and several soldiers laugh and cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have your starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping forward as  You staged all this to get your hands on my ship? Sybok regards Kirk in his grubby commando outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James T. Kirk, Captain of the  Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought Captain Chekov.. I see. Very clever, Captain. (turning t Spock with excitement) Spock, it would appear that you've been given a second chance to join me. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a Starfleet Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Of course. Then I'll take the ship without your help. The soldiers cheer wildly, waving their weapons in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: Waiting. Vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov, Scotty and a tense crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuttle en route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position, Bird of Prey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: The Klingon ship approaches Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa and Vixis react to Enterprise on their veiwscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Estimating attack range in 8,000 Kellicams.) Klaa casually slips into the gunner's rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Stealth approach. Slow to one quarter impulse power. Prepare to cloak.) A KLAXON SOUNDS. The bridge is bathed in red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Klingon;  (Engage cloaking device)

dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: The ship distorts and becomes invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty reacts to monitor screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, I've lost the Bird of Prey. She must have cloaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the shuttle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO it. Go to Red Alert. Scotty punches in commands. On his graphics screen a series of dots winks on around an outline of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: GALILEO
dialogues.text: Slowly heading back to the ship. Enterprise is in the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are guarded by J'onn and a select handful of Sybok's soldiers. Sulu and Uhura pilot the craft while Sybok confers with Caithlin and Korrd. The remainder of the Enterprise crew has been left behind on Nimbus III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we've taken control of your vessel, we'll bring up the rest of our followers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingons are out there. We'll be lucky to get back to the ship ourselves. They are interrupted by Chekov's voice on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galileo, this is Enterprise. Condition Red Alert. Bird of Prey approaching. She is cloaked. Raising shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recommend Galileo find safe harbor until situation secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acknowledge. Sulu and Uhura turn to Kirk for instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No reply. Remain on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, listen to me. In order for this craft to enter the landing bay, Enterprise must lower the shields and activate the tractor beam. To get us inside and re-raise the  shields will take-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly 15.5 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eternity during which we'll be vulnerable to Klingon attack. Korrd-you tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks the truth. If my people are cloaked, then they intend to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot turn back. Sybok regards Kirk with suspicion. He turns to Spock, the only one he can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must allow us to act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Do what you must-but no more. Kirk punches a button on the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingons have been monitoring the exchange between Enterprise and Galileo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Kirk! He's on the shuttlecraft! Alter the attack course!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand your situation. Are unable to return to planet. Stand by to execute... Emergency Landing plan.. B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov and Scotty exchange confused looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Emergency Landing Plan B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B as in "barricade."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE AND GALILEO
dialogues.text: The shuttle draws closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise looms through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to lower and raise the shields as quickly as possible, we're going to forego the tractor beam and fly her in manually. Manually?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How often have you done this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's my first attempt. Sybok looks at Kirk in amazement. Kirk smiles uneasily and indicates Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good. Really Scotty, on my mark. Open bay doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With agonizing slowness, the bay doors begin to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa flexes his itchy trigger-finger and peers into his view scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Stand by to decloak for firing!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk to Scotty-lower shields!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty punches in commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowering shields, sir. On Scotty's graphic's screen, the dots wink out around the outline of the ship. Enterprise is now vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey materializes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingon ship is sighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird of Prey bearing one zero five mark two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Sulu. Sulu hits the aft thrusters and the shuttle roars to life.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE AND GALILEO
dialogues.text: The shuttlecraft takes off with a tremendous kick. Like it was fired from a slingshot, the tiny craft closes the gap between itself and the Enterprise at alarming speed. the bay doors - they haven't opened wide enough yet. Just when it looks like the Galileo will pulp itself on t fantail, she banks ninety degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galileo negotiates the narrow opening by coming in on its side. It skids down the runway, showering sparks all the way, unable to stop. To our surprise, a cargo net pops up to keep it from crashing into the retaining wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shuttle recoils against the net, passengers are thrown about like rag dolls. Lights blow out and instrument panels EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa gapes in surprise. The target has zoomed out of his sights

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Bear on Enterprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Enterprise Targeted!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp speed now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa looks through the view scope, turns the firing handles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Fire!)

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: One moment she's there, the next she's gone in a flash of blinding light. Klaa's shot goes to the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaa reacts in amazement to Enterprise's sudden departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Track her course!) As Vixis and her crew hop to it, CAMERA PUSHES IN on Klaa who throws off his gunner's rig, unable to hide his admiration for Kirk's cleverness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in Klingon; subtitled) (He's good.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The badly-damaged Galileo lies smoldering on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the smoking wreckage, passengers have been flung everywhere. No one's been killed but are all dazed or unconscious. Sybok and Kirk come to simultaneously. But before Kirk can act, Sybok snatches up a primitive shooting weapon and aims it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must change our course at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Galileo's back hatch blows open emitting a cloud of smoke along with Kirk and Sybok. As Sybok steps down behind him, Kirk whirls and grabs for the weapon. The two men struggle and tumble across the landing bay floor.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SYBOK
dialogues.text: Kirk is no match for the Vulcan's superior strength but he fights with everything he's got. He manages to knock the weapon from Sybok's hand. It skitters across the floor and stops at the feet of Spock who has emerged from the shuttle. Spock looks down at the weapon, then back to Kirk whom Sybok is rendering helpless with one hand. With his incredible strength Sybok forces Kirk to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... pick it up! Spock obediently picks up the weapon like it was a distasteful object. Kirk collapses on the floor, consciou but no longer able to fight. Spock faces Sybok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, you must surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You must kill me. Sybok advances toward Spock until the weapon is pressing into Sybok's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him! But Spock can't shoot. The emotional price is too great. He lowers the weapon in shame and defeat. Sybok takes it from him with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, I thought you might actually do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok's soldiers emerge from the wreckage of the shuttle with McCoy. The doctor hurries to Kirk and helps him to his feet. Kirk, in pain and betrayed, glares at Spock who cannot meet his eyes. Sybok turns to J'onn. He indicates Kirk and McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in the brig with Captain Kirk. Spock, you will accompany me to the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I will not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm right. He is met by stony silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; a long pause) Then you must join them. J'onn and several other soldiers march Kirk, Spock and McCoy out.

dialogues.speaker: LANDING BAY
dialogues.text: Caithlin, Korrd and Talbot emerge from the shuttle with Sulu and Uhura in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These two will be useful. Uhura and Sulu are defiant. Sybok approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a moment alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: LANDING BAY CONTROL BUBBLE
dialogues.text: Scotty witnesses the action on the deck below. Fortunately, no one sees him. He steps back into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: BRIG
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are shoved into a cell by J'onn. Phaser beam bars materialize to contain them. Kirk is enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Spock. God damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, what have I done -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you have done is betray every man on this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse. I have betrayed you. I do not expect you to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive you? I ought to knock you on your goddamn ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think it would help. You want me to hold him, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay out of this! Why, Spock? Why? I.. All you had to do was pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had pulled the trigger,  Sybok would be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ordered you to defend this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ordered me to kill my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the man may be a fellow Vulcan, but that doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Captain. You do not understand. Sybok also in a son of Sarek. Kirk and McCoy can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he's your brother brother? You made that up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did too. Sybok couldn't possibly be your brother because I happen to know for a fact that you don't have a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, you are correct. I do not have a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, you see? See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a half brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta sit down. Let me get this straight. You and Sybok have the same father but different mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. That is correct. Sybok's mother was a Vulcan princess. Upon her death, Sybok and I were raised as brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not disposed to discuss... matters of a personal nature. For that, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sorry, See, he's sorry. Everything... that makes everything all right. He's sorry, everything's... Stop it, Jim. Spock could no more kill his own brother than he could kill you. If you want to punish him for what he's done, why don't you throw him in the brig? Kirk's anger burns itself out. Besides, we've got bigger problems to deal with. Like how the hell to get out of here. I'll say one thing, Spock. You never cease to amaze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor I myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors WHOOSH open to admit Uhura and Sulu. Chekov, in the command chair, stands to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was beginning to worry. Where is the Captain? Sybok enters, followed by the hostages and several armed soldiers. Chekov looks at Uhura and Sulu in confusion. They, like the hostages, are smiling warmly - converts to Sybok's cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right Pavel. Sybok will explain everything. Sulu moves past Chekov and takes his seat at the helm. He punches in commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plotting our new course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
