dialogues.text: New course? You have no authority. What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't force you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to listen to this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decision must be yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of us hides a secret pain. Share yours with me and gain strength from the sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk balances on Spock's shoulders, examining the ceiling, seeking a means of escape. Kirk uncovers a fixture. Spock shakes his head negatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Useless. Kirk stands on Spock's shoulders, now holding on to a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unwise. Kirk investigates a circuitry panel. He touches it and receives a shock that causes him to tumble to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've warned me. He did, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way out of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a new brig, Captain. It is escape-proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The designers tested it using the most intelligent and resourceful person they could find. He failed to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he and McCoy realize) This, er, person... didn't by any chance have pointed ears and an unerring capacity for getting his shipmates into trouble, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did have pointed ears.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: The ship continues at warp speed, DISAPPEARING FROM SHOT in  a blur of blinding light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura and Sulu are at their stations. Chekov once again occupies the command chair. Sybok stands beside him. In the background are Caithlin, Korrd and Talbot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following new course. Warp seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating destination in 6.7 hours, present speed. Sybok looks happy and paternal, less driven. He turns to Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that we're underway, it's time I announced my intentions to the rest of the ship. Brave crew of the Starship Enterprise... Consider the questions of existence. These are the questions which man has asked ever since he first gazed at the stars and dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy discontinue their efforts to escape and now peer instead at a monitor screen beyond the cell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Vulcan ancestors were ruled by their emotions. They felt with their hearts. They believed with their hearts. But above all else, they believed in a place in which these questions of existence would be answered. Modern dogma tells us this place is a myth, a fantasy concocted by pagans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crewman pauses to listen to Sybok's continuing speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is no fantasy! I tell you it exists!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the bridge to find crew and soldiers focused on Sybok's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers, we have been chosen to undertake the greatest adventure of all time - the discovery of Sha Ka Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffled responses from Kirk and McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he's found it. Sha Ka Ree. The reason Sybok left Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our destination is the planet Sha Ka Ree, which lies beyond the Great Barrier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock turns back to Sybok's image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... at the center of the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The center of the galaxy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There Sha Ka Ree is fabled to exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the center of the galaxy can't be reached. No ship has ever gone into the Great Barrier. No probe has ever returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok possessed the keenest intellect I have ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock! My only concern is getting the ship back. When that's done and Sybok is in here then you can debate Sha Ka Ree until you're green in the face. Until then, you're either with me or you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a little vague, Spock -  An infrequent, almost inaudible tapping SOUND comes from the back wall of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that noise? They turn and regard the back wall. The tapping continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it is a primitive form of communication known as Morse Code. They scramble over and huddle beside the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm a little out of practice. Uh....that's an "s."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "t."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "a"... "n"...uh, "d"... end of word. "Stand."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New word. "b".. "a"... um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "c."... "k." "Back." "Stand back." They're about to congratulate themselves when they realiz it's a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back!! They dive for cover as a large panel EXPLODES from the wall, showering them with dust. Scotty appears in the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you standing around for? Do you not know a jailbreak when you see one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, J'onn and Sulu exit the turbolift and head for the brig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bond between these three is strong... difficult to penetrate. This will be quite a challenge. The brig doors WHOOSH open. They step inside and are confronted with an empty cell. The prisoners have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to find them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty leads Kirk, Spock and McCoy through the labyrinth innards of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we can't trust anyone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could send a distress signal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an emergency sending apparatus in the forward observation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only problem is, it's up there. We're down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be able to reach it by means of turbo shaft number three which is closed for repairs. It's a long and dangerous climb. Some of us get off on long and dangerous climbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, get the transporter working. If we contact a rescue ship we'll need it. Which way to the turbo shaft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head down that tunnel to the hydro vent and turn right. Then left at the blowscreen. You can't miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, you're amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty walks off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's nothing amazing about it. I know this ship like the back of my hand. Scotty turns the corner and whacks his head on a low- hanging pipe. He collapses to the floor, out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning KLAXON SOUNDS. Sybok's soldiers sweep through the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy gaze up at a narrow and seemingly endless elevator shaft. An emergency ladder attached to the wall is the only way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, look at it this way. We'll get a good workout. Yeah. Or a heart attack. Kirk starts to climb the emergency ladder. McCoy reluctantly follows. Spock watches. Then, unnoticed, he slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu, leading a team of converts, rounds a corner and nearly stumbles over Scotty. Scotty groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Mr. Scott to sick bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk climbs hand over hand, followed by a huffing and puffing McCoy. Jim, this is going to take me forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Spock? Kirk and McCoy look down. No Spock. Just then, a soft WHOOSHING SOUND from above. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock descends wearing the levitation boots from Yosemite He floats alongside Kirk and McCoy, hovering in midair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I have found a faster way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Kirk breaks into a smile of relief. He steps off the ladder and grabs onto Spock. They dip down a few feet, then slowly rise to a hovering position beside McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones...? You two go ahead. I'll wait for the next car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not splitting up. Grumbling, a little fearful, McCoy steps on board. Their combined weight causes them to sink steadily downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would appear we are too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be all those marsh melons.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Sulu and the search party appear at the bottom of the shaft, armed with phasers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 173   ANGLE - KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY Sinking lower, on the verge of capture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... the booster rockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I activate them now, Captain, we will be propelled upward at an unbelievable rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire the rockets! Spock hits the boosters. With an explosion of power and NOISE they shoot skyward like a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Rocket smoke shoots downward enveloping Sulu and the  search party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, please come back down  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175   ANGLE - KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY Our hero's are an upward blur that shows no sign of stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the brakes! Spock hits "the brakes" and they stop barely one floor from the ceiling, bobbing in midair. Kirk and McCoy are white as sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I overshot the mark by one level. Nobody's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, deserted. The grandeur of space lies beyond the tall curving windows. Kirk, Spock and McCoy enter and cross to the communications console. Spock activates it. Functions come to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency channel, open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To anyone within the sound of my voice: This is Captain James T. Kirk of the Federation Starship Enterprise. If you read me, acknowledge. Acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, this is Starfleet Command. We read you. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostile force has seized control of our vessel and put us on a  direct course with the Great Barrier. Our coordinates are zero-zero-zero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...mark two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark two. Request emergency assistance. Acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reveal the "Starfleet Command" voice belongs to Vixis. Behind her Klaa sits, smugly confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) Understood, Enterprise. We are dispatching a rescue ship immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Starfleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Plot course zero-zero-zero, mark two.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (But Captain, that course will take us into the Barrier as well.) Klaa isn't about to let a small thing like death stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Klingon; subtitled) (Where Kirk goes, we follow.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy start for the exit when they are startled by the appearance of Sybok, J'onn and several armed soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust your message was received?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't expect us to stand by while you take the ship into the Great Barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you fear is the unknown. The people of your planet once believed their world was flat. Columbus proved it was round. They said the sound barrier could never be broken. It was broken. They said warp speed could not be achieved. The Great Barrier is the ultimate expression of this universal fear. It's an extension of personal fear. Captain Kirk, I so much want your understanding. I want your respect. Are you afraid to hear me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid of nothing. Sybok turns to J'onn and the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait outside. J'onn and the soldiers reluctantly withdraw. Sybok indicates for chairs, arranged in  circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you have many questions Here, amidst the stars of our own galaxy, we shall seek the answers together. The four men take their seats. The lighting becomes intimate. Sybok weaves his spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty awakens to find Uhura holding him in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, easy,  easy, Scotty. Easy. You're back with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, I had the strangest dream. I dreamt that a madman had taken over the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, dear, he' not a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sybok has simply put us in touch with feelings we've always been afraid to express. Uhura gives Scotty loving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.. er... have to get back the  transporter. Scotty slips out of her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Scotty - Scotty... There's so much I want to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could wait until I'm a wee bit stronger I don't think I could take it in my present condition. Or yours. Scotty heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the windows, the swirling vastness of space. Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Sybok sit in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sha Ka Ree. "The Scource." "Heaven." "Eden." call it "Qui'Tu." To the Romulans, it's "Vorta Vor." The Andorian word is.. unpronounceable. Still, every culture shares he common dream of a place from which creation sprang. For us, that place will soon be a reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only realty I see is that I'm a prisoner on my own ship. What is this power you have to control the minds of my crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't control minds. I free them. How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By making you face your pain and draw strength from it. Once that's done, fear cannot stop you. Sounds like brainwashing to me. Sybok closes his eyes and concentrates deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pain is the deepest of all. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel it. Can't you? A city skyline materializes in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard... It's some kind of trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard... Father? The surrounding walls come alive with energy. What follows is theatrical in style as we enter a subjective world. Oh my God, don't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181   ANGLE - McCOY He turns to find himself in a brilliantly white, sterile hospital room. A wasted figure reclines in a bed, an old man connected to a powerful life-support system. This is McCOY'S FATHER and we are somewhere in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard... McCoy rushes to the bedside. I'm here. I'm with you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pain... stop the pain. I've done everything I can do. You've got to hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand the pain. Help me. In the near background Sybok watches with Kirk and Spock. They are entranced by what they're seeing. All my knowledge and I can't save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done all you can. The support system will keep him alive. You call this alive? Father whispers something. McCoy bends down and puts his ear next to the old man's parched lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, release me... McCoy looks into his Father's eyes. The old man's gaze travels to the support machinery. He wants McCoy to shut it off. I can't do that, Dad. But how - how can I watch him suffer like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a doctor. I'm his son! McCoy reaches his decision. He shuts off the machine. The Father dies in his son's arms. Sybok appears at McCoy's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do it? To preserve his dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't the worst of it. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share it. McCoy hesitates, trembling. This is his dark secret. Not long after... they found a cure. A goddamn cure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you hadn't killed him he might have lived. No! I loved my father. I released him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you did what you thought was right. Yes. No! Yes! Sybok holds McCoy. The CAMERA PUSHES IN as they hold each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release this pain.. Release it. This pain has poisoned your soul for a long time. Kirk and Spock look at each other with concern. McCoy weeps for several moments, then wipes the tears away. He looks up at Sybok's comforting smile and is filled with a deep sense of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you've taken the first step. The other steps we'll take together. McCoy nods. Sybok turns to Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each man's pain is unique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hide no pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Captain. Proceed. O.S. a woman screams in agony.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: They turn and find themselves beneath the hanging stalactites of a cave. Torchlight throws weird shadows on the walls. The shadows depict a woman in labor, attended by a Vulcan High Priestess. Ceremonial DRUMS pound a throbbing pulse. The woman lets out another scream. It reverberates throughout the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we are witnessing my birth. Sybok appears beside them. He leads Spock and Kirk into the past.

dialogues.speaker: AS THEY APPROACH
dialogues.text: Spock's mother, the young earthwoman AMANDA, lies on a  rough pallet, her legs spread beneath her robes, her distended stomach lifting. Her only attendant is THE HIGH PRIESTESS who intones the Vulcan birthrights. Spock watches. A figure steps from the shadows. It is SAREK, Spock's Vulcan father. He observes his wife with typical detachment. As the DRUMS build in intensity, Amanda begins to deliver.

dialogues.speaker: CAVERN WALL
dialogues.text: The birth takes place in shadow. DRUMS reach a climax and stop. An infant cries. Amanda lifts the mewling babe from between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: Watching his entry into the world.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIESTESS
dialogues.text: She takes the baby from Amanda and holds it up. The tiny infant kicks and cries. Amanda reaches out for her child but the Priestess turns and presents the crying baby to Sarek instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So human.

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Spock turns away from Sybok and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... What have you done to my friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done nothing. This is who they are. Didn't you know that? The question hits Kirk with force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now learn something about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I refuse. Jim, try to be open about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? That I've made the wrong choices in my life? That I turned left when I should've turned right? I know what my weaknesses are. I don't need Sybok to take me on a tour of them. If you'd just unbend and allow yourself -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be brainwashed by this con man? I was wrong. This "con man" took away my pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Bones, you're a doctor. You know that pain and guilt can't be taken away with a wave of a  magic wand. They're things we carry with us - the things that make us who we are. If we lost them, we lose ourselves. I don't want my pain taken away. I need my pain. A tense silence, broken by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, this is the bridge. We're in approach of the Great Barrier. Sybok is filled with excitement, eager to go to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I'm afraid you'll have to remain here. Spock. Dr. McCoy... Come with me. Sybok and McCoy start for the exit but stop when they realize that Spock is remaining with Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, you are my brother, but you do not know me. I am not the outcast boy you left behind those many years ago. Since that time I have found myself and my place. I know who I am. And I cannot go with you. McCoy reacts to this speech. After a moment, he takes his place with Kirk and Spock. I guess you better count me out, too. Beyond the great windows, space is hanging, reflecting this unique part of the galaxy. Sybok regards Kirk, Spock and McCoy with affection. This is only a temporary setback. He knows the ultimate win will be his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll see you on the other side. Sybok heads for the exit. Doors WHOOSH open to reveal the guards outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! You know we'll never make it through the Great Barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we do, will that convince you that my vision was true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your vision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given to me by God. He waits for us on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? We'll see. The fiery look in Sybok's eyes might be confidence, it might be madness. He turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise is poised on the edge of the giant star cluster known as the Great Barrier. It is visually stunning and equally dangerous. We see giant regions of star formations as well as expanding blast waves from exploding stars. Beams of radiation from pulsars sweep the tiny and insignificant ship, bathing her in color.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: Sybok is on the bridge. Uhura, Chekov and Sulu are at their stations. Caithlin, Korrd and Talbot are also present. They and the rest of the crew are transfixed by the viewscreen, awed by the vista of a sky filled with thousands of stars, each a fiery orange. But what really draws their attention is the black thundercloud looming directly ahead. Here starts the ring of gas and dust that enshrouds the center of the galaxy, hiding it from view. Behind this black veil is a region that emits ten times more energy than our sun. Through the chinks in the wall we see flashes of blue light - hints of the fires blazing within. The hip's monitor screen goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say no ship can survive this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say they're wrong. I say the danger is an illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no instrument readings. Is it there or isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu... full ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full ahead, aye.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: And with that, the ship plows into the Barrier, straight into the dark clouds, disappearing from sight. We HOLD for a terrifying moment, wondering if we'll ever see Enterprise again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy experience a rush of elation. They gaze through the window at an incredible spacescape, unable to deny the sensation stirring within them. Sybok was right.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BARRIER
dialogues.text: Surprisingly, there is no turbulence, no buffeting. The Enterprise travels through a fantastic passageway of light and color. Then, quite suddenly, the gas clouds part and the ship enters a region of incredible calm and serenity, like the clear space at the eye of a hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok rises and looks in awe at the Great Barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead ahead, a single planet. A planet of great beauty and peace. Our final destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok smiles and glances around. Talbot stands in awe of the sight before him. CAMERA PUSHES IN on Caithlin's happy face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN toward Sha Ka Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating. Are we dreaming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we are, then life is a dream. Kirk, fascinated by the planet, moves to the antique ship's wheel. He absentmindedly rests his hand on it. His eyes are drawn to the plaque attached to the spokes of the wheel. On it, the charter of the Enterprise has been set in bronze. CAMERA MOVES IN on these words:

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWSCREEN
dialogues.text: The bridge buzzes with excitement. Monitor screens come to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instruments are back on line. Incredible. There's a power scource emanating form the planet like nothing I've ever seen. On the viewscreen, the planet appears up close  - a celestial orb, cloaked by swirling white clouds.  QUICK SHOTS of awed reactions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sha Ka Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qui'Tu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vorta Vor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge doors WHOOSH open to reveal Kirk, Spock and McCoy. The others turn, fearful of what he'll say or do. tense moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship needs its Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No special conditions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I won't turn us around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you, too, must know. Kirk looks at the hopeful faces around him. He feels the excitement of being on the verge of a great frontier, perhaps the greatest frontier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we're going to do it... ... we're going to do by the book. Mr. Chekov, you take the con. Mr. Sulu, standard orbital approach. Uhura, alert the shuttlecraft to stand by. Sybok, Spock, Dr. McCoy - come with me. The rest of you remain on board until I determine what we're dealing with. Kirk's eyes flash with excitement. To Sybok:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't just stand there. God's a busy man. Sybok happily joins them in the turbolift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bay doors open. Copernicus, the shuttle backup, emerges and drops from the mothership. Thrusters fire as it streaks toward the planet, disappearing into the swirling white clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock pilots the craft. He, McCoy and Kirk have changed into Starfleet uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDSHEILD
dialogues.text: Clouds part as if swept aside by hand. Beneath the shuttle a world opens up that can only be described as incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, Kirk, McCoy and Spock remain focused ahead, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copernicus skims over a rich abundant landscape awash with bright primary colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock removes his hands from the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am no longer in control of the craft. Kirk, Spock and McCoy regard each other with wary excitement, then turn their attentions to what lies ahead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circle of peaks appears in the distance, rising against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok smiles at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copernicus comes in for a soft landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines switch off. Kirk slips a communicator into his belt. He's about to pick up a hand phaser when he feels Sybok's disapproving eye upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We'll play it your way. He leaves the weapon behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exit hatch opens. Our four explorers emerge from the craft. They regard the prehistoric peaks with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing. The land... the sky... just as I knew it would be. They urgently start forward with Kirk leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew members abandon their posts and move forward to the viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four tiny figures pass through the peaks and look down into a naturally formed amphitheater. It's nothing more than a rough crater carved in the summit, ringed by the peaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, eyes fixed on the viewscreen, speaks urgently into her speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, you've got to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty is hard at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the time. The Captain told me to get this transporter working and I'm not about to let him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk walks around the base of the tall peak as the CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the crew marvels at the viewscreen, CAMERA PANS over to the defense station which is unattended. The screen blinks to life. A graphic of the Bird of Prey appears and a warning; "KLINGON VESSEL IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AWAITING COMMAND." A low warning BEEP. But no one's there to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Sybok descend into the bowl of the crater. They reach the center and stop. They  look at each other, wondering, "Is this all there is?" Sybok tries to hide his disappointment. He looks around for a sign that isn't there, then, after a moment of deafening silence, he addresses their bleak surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have traveled far by starship... Nothing. It looks like a bust. Sybok's voice chokes off and he lowers his head. Kirk and McCoy frown at each other. Kirk whips out his communicator to address the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, this is Kirk. We have, er... Spock goes to Sybok and puts a comforting hand on his brother's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, perhaps, er... Spock's words are obscured by a rumble from within the earth. A shadow engulfs the amphitheater.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY ABOVE
dialogues.text: Clouds turn ashen and threatening, transforming day into night.

dialogues.speaker: AMPHITHEATER
dialogues.text: The ground comes to life beneath the feet of our hero's. The earth buckles and ripples as if nature herself were trying to break free. Without warning a pillar of sheer rock rips through the surface and climbs skyward. Then another pillar shoots up, followed by another and another. They encircle the amphitheater like giant fingers. We INTERCUT Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Sybok reacting to this dazzling display of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fingers of rock form a crude cathedral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within this primitive cathedral, Kirk, Spock, McCoy and Sybok watch as the ground in front of them melts like molten lava. It swirls, creating a vortex. A RUSHING SOUND comes from the planet's core, growing closer. Something of incredible power is on its way to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaft of energy EXPLODES out of the vortex. It shoots skyward like an erupting power, blinding our heroes with its beauty and raw power.

dialogues.speaker: PLANET AND ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: The energy shaft rises from the planet like a beacon light. Enterprise, just outside the shaft, is bathed in its reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok staggers back. Like Kirk, Spock and McCoy, he must shield his eyes from the intensity of the energy shaft.

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY SHAFT
dialogues.text: It pulsates and throbs with life. A GOD-LIKE VOICE comes from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave souls. Welcome. Startled reactions. Is this the voice of God? As if responding to McCoy's question, the energy shaft throbs. From the swirling dust within it, a living form begins to take shape. The shape is powerful, beautiful, enticing. Sybok and the others watch in wonder. The wind it kicks up causes them to stagger back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within this maelstrom of power, the form of humanity begins to take shape. And it takes on many forms, each reminding us of the holy paintings that have depicted the Almighty through the ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One voice. Many faces.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: We INTERCUT between the shifting images of God and the reactions of the Enterprise crew. One moment the figure is Ra. The next, Allah. He's black. White. Female. Male. Andorian. Klingon. Each witness a flash of his own God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 228   KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY They watch the "God Show" with mounting fascination.

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY SHAFT
dialogues.text: The Being synthesizes into the Biblical Heavenly Father of our imagination. (Note: The Being is contained within the perimeters of the energy shaft, unable to venture out of it.) The Being turns his gaze on Sybok, Kirk, Spock and McCoy. He beams with pleasure. His eyes twinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this better suit your expectations? It does indeed. No one knows what to say. Sybok is vindicated; he can barely contain his ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qual se tu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is I. The journey you undertook to reach me could not have been an easy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not. The Barrier stood between us - but we breached it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnificent. You are the first to find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sought only your infinite wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did you breach the Barrier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a starship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This starship, could it carry my wisdom beyond the Barrier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I shall make use of this starship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be your chariot! Kirk politely raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will carry my power to every corner of creation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The Being regards Kirk like he was a pesky insect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like to ask a question. McCoy looks at Kirk like he just farted in church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does God need with a starship? The Being returns his attention to Sybok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the ship closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... what does God need with a starship? Jim, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking a question. The Being once again regards Kirk. Kirk stands his ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this creature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I? Don't you know? Aren't you God? The smile leaves The Being's face. THUNDER RUMBLES faintly in the distance, underscoring his displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has his doubts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doubt me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seek proof. Jim, you don't ask the Almighty for his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then here is the proof that you seek. A bolt of energy shoots from The Being's eye and strikes Kirk full in the chest, knocking him to the ground. Spock and McCoy look on in shock as Kirk, injured, tries to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew can't comprehend this turn of events. Korrd, Caithlin and Talbot look at each other in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why.. is God... angry? Sybok is confounded. He addresses The Being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why have you done this to my friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doubts me. Spock takes it upon himself to step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have not answered his question. What does God need with a starship? The Being's countenance turns dark. Another bolt shoots from his eye and heads for Spock. CRASH! Spock is knocked to the ground. The Being turns to McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you doubt me? McCoy looks at The Being's handiwork - his injured friend I doubt any God who inflicts pain for his own pleasure. The Being is on the verge of zapping McCoy when Sybok interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! The God of Sha Ka Ree would not do this! By way of reply, The Being smiles a truly wicked smile and Sybok realizes to his horror that he's been tricked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sha Ka Ree? A vision you created. An eternity I've been imprisoned in this place! The ship! I must have the ship! Now give me what I want! Spock shouts to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok - this is not the God of Sha Ka Ree - or any other God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.. Reveal yourself to me!

dialogues.speaker: THE BEING
dialogues.text: Before our stunned eyes The Being changes into Sybok himself - a dark, sinister reflection of Sybok. This Evil Sybok laughs, enjoying the reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Don't you like this face? I have so many. But this one suits you best.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE SYBOK
dialogues.text: His self-realization is painful to behold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, it's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me the ship or I will destroy you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it closer so that I might join with it. Do it, or watch these puny things die horribly. The Being indicates Spock and McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his communicator) Kirk to Enterprise. Listen carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my doing. This is my arrogance... my vanity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok, we must find a way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You must save yourselves. Forgive me, brother. Forgive me. Sybok raises his hand to Spock in the Vulcan gesture of farewell, then turns to face The Being, gathering up all his power. Spock starts forward but Kirk holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEING AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: Sybok has no fear as he confronts his evil mirror image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to The Being) I couldn't help but notice you pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It runs deep. Share it with me. Sybok boldly enters the shaft and embraces his evil twin.

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY HAFT
dialogues.text: An amazing spectacle. As they grapple, the good and evil Syboks merge into one twisting, thrashing body, clearly at battle with itself. The good Sybok tears himself loose. He dominates the struggle until the evil Sybok manages to rip through and fight back. The two Syboks, good and evil, battle on... merging, tearing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise... are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu and Chekov in action. Sulu uses all the tricks of the pilot's trade to angle the ship into the best possible attack position. Chekov punches commands into the weapons console, plotting the correct torpedo trajectory. It's like watching two master magicians play a symphony in a windstorm. The screens in front of them blink and flash with graphic displays and warnings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In firing position. Torpedo armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Captain, we're firing directly on your position.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PLANET
dialogues.text: Sybok continues to grapple with his evil twin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it down, Mr. Chekov. Now!

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRIE AND ENERGY SHAFT
dialogues.text: A photo torpedo leaves the dish and streaks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CHASES the torpedo down the shaft and into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impact is seconds away. Kirk, Spock and McCoy run for cover. From far beneath the surface of the planet comes the SOUND of the EXPLOSION. The ground blisters and puckers.

dialogues.speaker: AMPHITHEATER
dialogues.text: Our heroes dive for cover as a BLINDING EXPLOSION erupts from the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke. Debris. The cathedral is in disarray. An eerie silence. Kirk, Spock and McCoy emerge from cover. The energy shaft is a memory. In its place there is only a gaping hole, glowing raw and red like a wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sybok... A RUMBLING SOUND from within the earth. The hole throbs. It pulsates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 243   KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY They haul ass up the side of the amphitheater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov and Sulu still at work at the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu, I've lost them. They desperately try to locate Kirk, Spock and McCoy on the planet below.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE STATION
dialogues.text: The unattended screen still depicts the Bird of Prey. "ESTIMATED TIME OF INTERCEPT: 4 MINUTES." Then, the graphic of the ship vanishes and is replaced with this warning: "CLOAKING DEVICE ENGAGED. POSITION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy reach the top and rush to Copernicus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy make it inside. The door closes behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, get us out of here! Before Spock can act a tremendous blow rocks the shuttle. There's something out there and it wants to get in.  Spock tries the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrusters are inoperative. Kirk whips out his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me the transporter is working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got partial power, sir. I might be able to take two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beam up Spock and Dr. McCoy. Now! Before Spock and McCoy can protest, the transporter beam shimmers down and takes them away. Now just a damn min... Spock and McCoy vanish in a glow of light as they are beamed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock and McCoy step off the platform. Scotty is at the control console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Scott. Beam up the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye-aye.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE AND BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: The Klingon ship has decloaked and fired from a position directly in front of the Enterprise. In cowboy terms, it' got the drop on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise absorbs a terrific jolt. Spock, McCoy and Scotty go flying as the transporter EXPLODES in a shower of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: Firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk turns to see another BLINDING EXPLOSION. He looks frightened; realizes he's not going to be beamed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew painfully pulls itself together. Fires are put out. Auxiliary power comes on. Spock, McCoy and Scotty enter. What about Jim? We can't just leave him down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get a grip on yourself, Doctor. Status report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon Captain wishes to name his terms, Mr. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. Klaa appears on the veiwscreen, arms folded across his chest, seated triumphantly in his command chair. He speaks English for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Klaa of the Klingon Empire. Attempt to raise shields or arm weapons and I will destroy you. You are alive for a single reason. The renegade James T. Kirk. Hand him over and I will spare your lives. My transporter stands ready to beam him aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk is not among us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Vulcan. I'm incapable of lying. Captain Kirk is on the planet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me his coordinates! Spock glimpses a possibility. He turns to Korrd and speaks with urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, I am in need of your assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are his superior officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a foolish old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, sir, you will try! Korrd sees that Spock will not take no for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey flies toward the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon Commander, someone wishes to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk scrambles from one hiding place to another.

dialogues.speaker: PINNACLE
dialogues.text: With nowhere to go but up, Kirk scales a steep pinnacle. He climbs with agility and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk climbs up as a bolt of light hits the rock before him. The blue light and smoke of The Being pulsates from the rocky face of the mountain. The eyes of The Being glow white. There's a WHOOSHING SOUND from above. Kirk looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SKY ABOVE
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey drops out of the storm clouds. Its guns come to life and strafe the rock creature.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Vulnerable atop the pinnacle. The Bird of Prey hovers directly above him, its guns swiveling in his direction. Kirk is determined to go down fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's me you want, you Klingon bastards! What are you waiting for?! The Bird of Prey's transporter beam shimmers down and engulfs him. Kirk disappears in its sparkling light, saved from The Being who lets out an angry roar of defeat. The Bird of Prey takes off with its prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk materializes. He's immediately seized by two brutal-looking Klingons. They march him out of the transporter room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge doors slide open and Kirk is brought in. The Klingon crew regard him from their stations. Klaa is off to one side looking petulant. Korrd stands beside him, chest puffed up with pride, obviously in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release him. The guards step away from Kirk. Klaa glares at Korrd but it's clear the older Klingon is now calling the shots. Kirk regards Korrd with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, my junior officer has something he wants to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize. Korrd speaks to Klaa in Klingon once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attack upon your vessel was not authorized by my government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, and now, may I present our new gunner. The command chair swivels around to reveal its occupant to be Spock. He unstraps himself from the gunner's rig, stands up and straightens his uniform in a dignified manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, Captain. Kirk regards the stoic Spock with affection and wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, I thought I was going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible. You were never alone. Kirk fights back tears and clasps his friend in a hug. Spock stiffens with embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Captain, not in front of the Klingons. Kirk laughs and hugs him all the harder. Spock tentativel hugs him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise and Bird of Prey are side by side, in orbit around the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingon polishes off a tumbler of fluid. He frowns. What he wants is a real drink. Scotty approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care for a wee nip of Scotch whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummmm... Scotty produces a bottle and pours a splash into the Klingon's tumbler. Korrd downs it with obvious relish. Scotty smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought I'd ever be drinking with a Klingon, heh? Korrd chortles agreeably and moves off. We FOLLOW him over to Talbot and Caithlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two conspiring about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just saying how far we've come in such a short space of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We certainly have.

dialogues.speaker: SULU AND CHEKOV
dialogues.text: The doors slide open and Vixis, Sulu and Chekov enter the room, Vixis leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has wonderful muscles.

dialogues.speaker: KLAA
dialogues.text: Vixis walks to Klaa. When they see him, Chekov and Sulu suddenly stop and turn away. Klaa waves off a waiter who offers him a drink. He approaches a table where Kirk sits talking to crewmen. Klaa gives him the Klingon chest-thumping salute.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: With a smile, Kirk returns the Klingon salute. He notices Spock and McCoy standing at the window, staring out, oblivious to the party around them. Kirk approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosmic thoughts, gentlemen? We were speculating. ... is God really out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not out there, Bones. Maybe he's right here... in the  human heart Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of Sybok. I've lost a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I lost a brother once. I was lucky. I got him back. I thought you said men like us  don't have families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong. CAMERA PUSHES IN on them as the three men smile their understanding at one another and we slowly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK from a roaring campfire. McCoy pours two cups full of bourbon and hands one to Kirk who sets aside his marshmallow on a stick. Kirk and McCoy clink cups in a silent toast and drink, distracted by strange PLINKING SOUNDS from close by. Spock is revealed, absently strumming his Vulcan lute, in search of a tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you just going to sit there and pluck that thing? Or are you going to play something? The plinks and plunks gradually become a tune. The unmistakable "Row Your Boat." Kirk and McCoy react with delight. Kirk takes a hit of bourbon and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream, merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream." Spock jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream, merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream." Kirk sits down at the fire. He reaches over and taps McCoy, encouraging him to join the songfest. "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream, merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream." As they continue to sing we execute the greatest PULLBACK of all time. The campfire becomes a dot of light. The dot of light joins other dots of light. They become stars of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROLL END CREDITS OVER as the group continues to sing.
